abstracts.cdata!:
The International Development
            Association (IDA) and Albania signed a development credit
            agreement for the Social Services Delivery Project for
            approximately United States (U.S.) 12 million dollars. This
            report provides the findings of an administrative inquiry by
            the World Bank Group (WBG) Integrity Vice Presidency (INT)
            into allegations that Company A may have engaged in
            misconduct in connection with the project in the Republic of
            Albania. The purpose of the investigation was to allow the
            WBG to determine if the WBG’s framework regarding
            anti-corruption has been violated. Company A submitted its
            bid for the contract. The bid contained several
            manufacturer’s authorization forms (MAFs), including one
            that purportedly was issued by Company B. Evidence suggests
            that Company B informed the project implementing unit (PIU)
            that it had not issued the MAF to Company A. Upon the PIU’s
            request to extend the bid validity for the third time,
            Company A replied that it will not proceed with the third
            extension of the bid validity and respective bid security
            validity. Thus, Company A’s bid was not considered for
            further evaluation.
